description: The cause of CVE-2023-6348 is a type confusion flaw within the spellcheck component of the Chromium open-source software that is utilized by Microsoft Edge (chromium-based). This technical condition allows an attacker to exploit the improper handling of specific data types, which could lead to unintended behavior or execution of arbitrary code. Microsoft Edge version 119.0.2151.97 has addressed this vulnerability, reflecting the integration of the updated Chromium framework. The flaw was documented as part of ongoing efforts to enhance security in Microsoft products dependent on Chromium, such as Edge. The knowledge base article associated with this patch is KB-119.0.2151.97, which provides further insights into the fix and its implications on system security.
